why_it_matters: 2014 NICE guidance on primary and secondary lipid modification
recommends the use of a high-intensity statin (i.e. one that reduces LDL cholesterol by 40% or more) with a low acquisition cost.
A table showing the percentage reduction of LDL cholesterol by statin doses can be found
here and you can read our research paper on suboptimal
statin treatment regimens in the British Journal of General Practice.Please note, we have excluded

SUM(p.items * (CASE WHEN ing.id = 725658002 AND strnt_nmrtr_val/(coalesce(strnt_dnmtr_val,1)) >=20 THEN 0 --atorvastatin 20mg and above 
WHEN ing.id = 406435003 AND strnt_nmrtr_val/(coalesce(strnt_dnmtr_val,1))>=10 THEN 0 --rosuvastatin 10mg and above 
WHEN ing.id = 387584000 AND strnt_nmrtr_val/(coalesce(strnt_dnmtr_val,1)) >=80 THEN 0 --simvastatin 80mg and above 
ELSE 1 END)) AS numerator
